intro: Eriostemon virgatus, commonly known as the slender-flowered eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy soils. Eriostemon virgatus is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, thriving in full sun and well-drained conditions.
